page.title: 08Landmark Church Cockermouth
page.content: All Saints' Church is the landmark of Cockermouth. Its spire can be seen miles away in all directions and the clock chimes heard every hour. I was allowed to look round everything I saw the vestry, and the priest's vestry where the records show William Wordsworth's baptism on 14th Jan.1772. There is a stained glass window to his memory also. It is the East window.The 180 foot spire is supported by square pillars and there is a long Chancel. I went outside to the door into the belfry. A spiral staircase led up. I crossed the outer parapet into the bell tower where eight bells peal for services and weddings. I noticed the bell ringers belong to the Ancient Society of College Youths and have the distinction of ringing the peal of Yorkshire Surprise Major, the first in Cumbria by a resident band of ringers.
